Dwarven Toughness

Gold Dwarf is a Subrace of Dwarf in Baldur's Gate 3. Gold Dwarf starts with a bonus 1 Hit Point and gains another point each time they level up. While creating your Character in Baldur's Gate 3, you can choose between 11 different types of Races. Each of them has their special characteristics and some of them have Sub-Races which provide different Features and Traits.

BG3 Full Game Note: In the full launch of Baldur's Gate 3, Ability Score Points for Races that were present in Early Access are removed. And instead, Ability Score Points in the full game correspond with the Class players will choose.

Gold dwarves are known for their confidence and keen intuition. The culture of their Deep Kingdom values family, ritual, and fine craftmanship.

Gold Dwarf Traits in Baldur's Gate 3

Dwarven Toughness: Your hit point maximum increases by 1 for every level you have.

BG3 Dwarf Traits

Base Racial Speed: Move up to 7.5m per turn. Dwarven Combat Training: Proficiency with the Battleaxe, Handaxe, Light Hammer, and Warhammer Darkvision: See in the dark up to 12m. Dwarven Resilience: Advantage on Saving Throws against Poison, and Resistance against Poison damage.

Gold Dwarf Tips & Notes

During Early Access, the Gold Dwarf race used to feature +2 Constitution and 1+ Wisdom. This has been changed in the full launch of BG3 and the Ability Score points are now associated with the Class that players will choose. Notes and tips go here.
